main event: A spherical transparent glass-like object was reported to have descended and struck a mailbox in Lombard, Illinois on 21 May 1952.
interesting points: The object was 1-1/2 inches in diameter and partially covered with a black and reddish material., The object left black lines on the surface where it struck the ground., An F-86 aircraft had just flown over the area before the object was observed., The object was hot to the touch when it was located by the witness., The object's origin was unknown, and it was speculated to have been propelled from a nearby location.
witness description: Civilian who reported the sighting and later picked up the object
